intro: Stylogyne braunii, commonly known as the braunii stylogyne, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Stylogyne braunii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
